intro: Oreocomopsis aromatica, commonly known as the sweet everlasting, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late summer, followed by fluffy, white seed heads. Its aromatic foliage and long-lasting flowers make it a popular choice for dried floral arrangements. Oreocomopsis aromatica is well adapted to arid environments and thrives in full sun.
